title: How long does it take to get a degree for a veterinary job? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the U.S, it takes FOREVER. First, you have to get through a little over twelve years of school (kindergarten, elementary, middle school, high school). After you’ve graduated from high school, you have to take four years of pre-veterinary medicine. After those four years, you have to take another four years at one of only twenty-eight accredited veterinary schools in the country. Depending on what type of veterinarian you want to be (mixed practice, canine/feline, small pets, reptiles, etc) you have to take additional courses.
In the UK it is 5–6 years full time study
